For each of the following criteria, please select the option that best indicates the proportion of the company's employees which had policies in place regarding each of the conditions described below during the reporting period :
Child labour: The company adheres to the minimum working ages defined by the ILO when hiring workers.
National minimum working ages vary from 14-18 depending on the country, and the type of work performed. See ILO Convention No. 138 for details.
Part-time employees: Part-time employees receive the same benefits and protections as comparable full-time employees, but on a proportionate basis.
This includes proportionate basic wages, holidays, social security, employment conditions, freedom from discrimination, (etc) as comparable full-time workers. See ILO Convention No. 175 for details.
Freedom of association: Employees have the right to join or form trade unions of their choice (or opt not to), and bargain collectively.
Fair working hours: Employees are not required to work more than 40 hours per week, with overtime being optional and paid at a higher rate.
This is applicable even within markets where national laws allow longer working weeks.
Holiday: Employees have the right to at least three working weeks of paid leave per year.
Employees must receive at least their normal or average remuneration during this holiday.
Maternity / Paternity leave: Employees have right to at least 14 weeks pay at 2/3 pay.
This is applicable to employees regardless of gender.
